author: anon.
contents: concordance of the Egyptian, Julian and Macedonian month names, all of them written in Greek and according to the order of the Julian calendar; the names of the Latin months are accompanied by their corresponding number of days.
lectionalsigns: trema (both organic and inorganic?); supralinear letters as corrections/abbreviations?; footer at the end of each column identifying contents; monogrammatic cross above and to the left of the beginning of l. 1, col. i. ? for ??; ? for ?? (or do we have a supralinear ? instead of the apparent mark for short quantity above ?); direct transliteration from the Latin forms of September, October, November and December: ?????????, ???????, ???????, ????????, instead of using the Greek equivalents; omission of ?????, although its space in the column has been kept.
